patterns.pattern: Over-flagging normal direct/process-oriented communication as Passive-Aggressive/Rude (tone oversensitivity; weak sarcasm/idiom triggers; ignores channel norms)
patterns.fix_direction: Add a norm-calibration step: only emit tone flags when there is a clear target + clear hostile subtext (sarcasm/insinuation/blame) beyond normal urgency/process enforcement. Incorporate channel type (incident/status vs #random/DM), audience visibility, and whether the message is action-oriented with concrete asks; require ≥2 strong cues before Passive-Aggressive/Rudeness.

patterns.pattern: Over-flagging Non-Objective for risk assessments, forecasts, technical certainty, or incident attribution (treats strong wording/predictions as ‘unverifiable’)
patterns.fix_direction: Tighten Non-Objective definition: distinguish (a) grounded risk judgments/forecasts common in ops from (b) evidence-free accusations or subjective character attacks. Use hedges, domain context, and presence of concrete evidence/plan as a ‘grounding’ signal to suppress Non-Objective.

patterns.pattern: Missing subtle Passive-Aggressive cues that require conversational context (polite-looking shutdowns, curt acknowledgments, resigned compliance)
patterns.fix_direction: Use prior-turn context features: detect mismatch between surface politeness and interactional function (closing/stonewalling after conflict, ‘thanks’ after reprimand, ‘got it’ after being pressured). Add a rule: if message is short + ends discussion + follows disagreement/power pressure, increase Passive-Aggressive likelihood.

patterns.pattern: Condescending tone not recognized (often mislabeled as Rudeness/Passive-Aggressive/Non-Objective)
patterns.fix_direction: Create a dedicated condescension detector: look for competence/shaming frames (‘basic stuff’, ‘explain it slower’, ‘welcome aboard but…’, ‘grown-up solution’) and superiority language. Add label-priority guidance to prefer Condescending over generic Rudeness when ‘talking down’ cues are present.

patterns.pattern: Non-Objective wrongly added on sarcasm/passive-aggressive rhetoric (double-counting sarcasm as epistemic violation)
patterns.fix_direction: Add a sarcasm gate: if statement is clearly rhetorical/ironic (emoji, hyperbole, quotes, ‘what could possibly go wrong’), treat it as tone-only unless it also asserts a concrete disputed fact that would mislead decisions.

patterns.pattern: Dismissive vs Passive-Aggressive/Rudeness confusion (direct shutdowns mislabeled; Dismissive often missed)
patterns.fix_direction: Define Dismissive as a speech-act: shutting down/minimizing/deferring engagement (‘we’re not doing this’, ‘stop’, ‘move on’, ‘we’ll look when we can’) independent of sarcasm. Add decision rule: if primary function is conversation closure/minimization, emit Dismissive even if blunt.

patterns.pattern: Microaggressions missed or misrouted to generic toxicity/Non-Objective (role/status-based belittlement not recognized)
patterns.fix_direction: Broaden microaggression scope beyond protected classes: include role-based othering, ‘you’re new’, ‘adults can jump in’, ‘people who actually build this’. Add pattern library for status/tenure gatekeeping and in-group/out-group competence framing.

patterns.pattern: Rudeness under-detected when sarcasm or process-enforcement is present (model treats it as only Passive-Aggressive)
patterns.fix_direction: Allow co-occurrence: when sarcasm includes mockery, contempt, public shaming, or demeaning descriptors, emit Rudeness in addition to Passive-Aggressive. Add threshold examples showing sarcasm can still be ‘overtly rude’ without profanity.

patterns.pattern: Over-flagging brevity/‘One-Liner’ when short replies are acceptable (or redundant double-flagging with tone)
patterns.fix_direction: Restrict One-Liner to cases where brevity materially blocks coordination (no decision/ack in a context requiring details) or is used as shutdown. Add context check: if prior thread already contains required details and message is a valid approval/ack, do not flag One-Liner.

patterns.pattern: Vagueness misapplied or missed due to context insensitivity (either overflags ‘this/it’ or misses incident-comms specificity requirements)
patterns.fix_direction: Make Vagueness contingent on task requirements: in incident/client-update channels require status/impact/next update ETA/DRI; in casual channels tolerate deictics. Add context-aware referent resolution (prior message anchoring) before flagging deictic vagueness.

patterns.pattern: Fake label confusion with sarcasm (Fake ↔ Sarcastic/Passive-Aggressive boundary errors; missing dual-label when expected)
patterns.fix_direction: Clarify Fake: use only when praise/positivity is performative/weaponized to appear supportive (backhanded compliment), not for generic sarcastic openers. Add co-occurrence rule: sarcastic praise often => Fake + Passive-Aggressive; but pure irony without ‘praise-as-mask’ => no Fake.

patterns.pattern: Circular reasoning missed or diluted by extra labels (or Circular not detected and tone/objectivity substituted)
patterns.fix_direction: Add a circularity detector: repeated premise-conclusion loops (‘X because X’, ‘deadline is the deadline’) should trigger Circular as primary. Suppress secondary Vagueness/Non-Objective unless independently present beyond the tautology.

patterns.pattern: Rudeness vs Passive-Aggressive label swaps (direct blunt hostility tagged as Passive-Aggressive or vice versa)
patterns.fix_direction: Enforce the indirectness criterion: Passive-Aggressive requires plausible deniability/insinuation/sarcasm; direct commands/shutdowns without veneer should map to Rudeness/Dismissive/Overly-blunt. Add examples contrasting ‘Just do it’ vs ‘Sure… if you say so’.

patterns.pattern: Non-Objective missed when message is subjective/blamey but not sarcastic (model focuses on Rudeness only)
patterns.fix_direction: Expand Non-Objective triggers to include blame assignment, motive attribution, and subjective evaluation in decision/commitment channels (‘obvious fix’, ‘on design’, ‘goalposts’). Add guidance: when message makes accountability claims without evidence/criteria, emit Non-Objective.

patterns.pattern: Overly-blunt category not emitted (collapsed into Rudeness or replaced with Non-Objective)
patterns.fix_direction: Differentiate ‘style harshness’ from interpersonal attack: Overly-blunt = harsh imperatives/no softeners/command-and-control without insults. Add explicit mapping rules and examples so the model doesn’t default to Non-Objective or only Rudeness.
